items.title: Allow users of allure-behave to specify link patterns to Issue & TMS tracking systems
items.body:
#### I'm submitting a ... 
  - [ ] bug report
  - [x] feature request
  - [ ] support request => Please do not submit support request here, see note at the top of this template.

#### What is the current behavior?

At the moment the only way (that I'm aware of) to link a scenario to a TMS or Issue Tracking system in `allure-python` is to use specialised scenario tags which contain the whole URL to the ticket/issue, e.g.: 
```gherkin
@allure.link:http://tms.system.com/ticket-55
@allure.issue:http://bug.tracking.com/BUG-42
Scenario: Annotated with links to TMS and Issue Tracker
...
```
 
More on that in the source code https://github.com/allure-framework/allure-python/blob/master/allure-python-commons/src/mapping.py#L21

This works, but it:
* adds extra repetitive work by forcing users to always include the whole link to a ticket/bug
* exposes potentially sensitive information about location of an Issue or TMS tracking systems (not all people or teams can reveal such information)

`allure-java` allows users to define link patterns to such systems. They're nicely documented in here https://docs.qameta.io/allure/#_links


#### What is the expected behavior?

Allow Python users to define link patterns to a TMS and Issue tracking systems so that Allure can replace `{}` placeholders with value specified in appropriate tag (`@allure.link` & `@allure.issue` respectively. 
PS. Maybe these tags could be even shortened to just `link` & `issue`?).

It'd be amazing if we'd be able to specify those link patterns as environmental variable, or as an additional parameter passed to Behave's Allure formatter, just like it's done in `pytest` using dynamic links and `--allure-link-pattern` parameter:
* https://github.com/allure-framework/allure-python/blob/master/allure-pytest/examples/link/dynamic_link.rst
* https://github.com/allure-framework/allure-python/blob/master/allure-pytest/test/acceptance/link/link_pattern_test.py#L11

#### What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior?

* reduce time required to maintain the test suite
* give Allure users greater flexibility in regard to report customisation
* reduce the risk of exposing potentially sensitive information

#### Please tell us about your environment:

- Allure version: 2.13.1
- Test framework: behave@1.2.6
- Allure adaptor: allure-behave@2.8.9
- Python: 3.8

#### Other information 

* Giiter chat where I discussed the issue with Dmitry Baev:
https://gitter.im/allure-framework/allure-core?at=5e3c2f6ffe0e6f74e906c58e

items.title: 'allure-pytest-bdd' report marks feature as 'Fail' even when all steps pass when test is using 'Scenario Outline'
items.body: [//]: # ( . Note: for support questions, please use Stackoverflow or Gitter**. . This repository's issues are reserved for feature requests and bug reports. . . In case of any problems with Allure Jenkins plugin** please use the following repository . to create an issue: https://github.com/jenkinsci/allure-plugin/issues . . Make sure you have a clear name for your issue. The name should start with a capital . letter and no dot is required in the end of the sentence. An example of good issue names: . . - The report is broken in IE11 . - Add an ability to disable default plugins . - Support emoji in test descriptions ) #### I'm submitting a ... - [X] bug report - [ ] feature request - [ ] support request => Please do not submit support request here, see note at the top of this template. #### What is the current behavior? When generating an allure report for pytest-bdd test; the report shows test feature marked as Fail although all steps in the test are marked as Pass. The test is using Scenario Outline and running for 12 data sets. #### If the current behavior is a bug, please provide the steps to reproduce and if possible a minimal demo of the problem 1. Create a test in pytest-bdd feature file. _sample from my test_ - ``` @regression Feature: Some description As blah Scenario Outline: value comparison Given the exists When the with the for the is provided in the Then verify that CDP mapping for with matches for the Examples: | feed_file | attribute_name | attribute_value | customer_id | | Customer.csv | FirstName | Taylor | 8470939 | | Customer.csv | LastName | Perry | 8470936 | | CustomerEmail.csv | Email | justsomeemail@gmail.com | 8470939 | ``` 2. From terminal, run `pytest --activedir=` 3. Verify that multiple JSON files are generated under report folder when execution completes. 4. Open any one JSON file. 5. The report JSON shows feature status as 'Fail' even when all test step status shown as 'Pass' #### What is the expected behavior? Feature status should be marked as 'Pass' when all steps inside the test are 'Pass'. #### What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior? Bug Fix #### Please tell us about your environment: - allure-pytest-bdd version: 2.8.6b0 - pytest version: 5.3.2 - pytest-bdd version: 3.2.0 #### Other information . When same test is executed and report is generated using pytest-html, all tests show as Pass. . Allure report screenshot

. Note: for support questions, please use Stackoverflow or Gitter**. 
. This repository's issues are reserved for feature requests and bug reports.
.

. to create an issue: https://github.com/jenkinsci/allure-plugin/issues
.
. Make sure you have a clear name for your issue. The name should start with a capital 
. letter and no dot is required in the end of the sentence. An example of good issue names:
.
. - The report is broken in IE11
. - Add an ability to disable default plugins
. - Support emoji in test descriptions
)

#### I'm submitting a ... 
  - [x] bug report
  - [ ] feature request
  - [ ] support request => Please do not submit support request here, see note at the top of this template.

#### What is the current behavior?
When running a concurrent test execution (i.e. multiple py.test instances), there is a race condition between os.path.exists() and os.makedirs(), causing the later to throw OSError.

#### If the current behavior is a bug, please provide the steps to reproduce  
Hard to demo, but easy to fix


#### What is the expected behavior?
There should be a robust directory creation process, resilient if the folder already exist

#### What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior?
Bug fix

- Test framework:        pytest@5.2.2
- Allure adaptor:        allure-pytest@2.8.6

items.title: Can't use allure report with pytest under mac
items.body:
Hi, I'm having trouble with allure reports using pytest. It seems allure command is recognized but somehow when I add it in the pytest command as a parameter it causes an error and exits. Maybe I'm missing something, here's command line:

`pytest.main("--maxfail=50 /Users/distiller/project/tests --alluredir=/Users/distiller/project/tests/build/reports")`
If I use `--junitxml` instead it works.

I'm triggering tests under a remote Mac using CircleCi tool. Here's mac build configuration:

```
version: 2
jobs:
  build:
    macos:
      xcode: "10.1.0"
    steps:
      - checkout
      - run:
          halt_build_on_fail: false
          name: Setup environment for test
          command: |
             xcodebuild -version
             pip install -U selenium
             pip install --upgrade pip
             pip install -U webium
             pip install pytest
             pip install -U pytest-allure-adaptor
             pip install pytest-html
             pip install pyperclip==1.5.27
             pip install seleniumwrapper
             pip install pycrypto
             pip install requests
             pip install -U py2app
             brew install pigz
             python -c "import selenium; print(selenium.__version__)"
             brew install allure
             sudo /usr/bin/safaridriver --enable
      - run:
          name: Make Unit Test
          command: |

            py2applet --make-setup tests_runner.py
            python setup.py py2app -A
            open -a /Users/distiller/project/tools/dist/tests_runner.app
            testrunner=$(eval "ps -ef | grep -v "grep" | grep 'tests_runner' | wc -l")
            while [ "$testrunner" != 0 ]
            do

                echo "running tests.."
                sleep 5
            done

      - run:

items.title: Update behave docs - add something about allure hook around environment.py
Pytest 4.5.0 now displays warning for non declared markers (Eventually errors)
items.body:
When using allure, we are now seeing the following outputs with pytest 4.5.0 (These warnings are eventually going to become errors in pytest 4.6.0 (or some time similar)

some (but not all examples are):

```python
PytestUnknownMarkWarning,_pytest/mark/structures.py:324: PytestUnknownMarkWarning: Unknown pytest.mark.allure_label.epic - is this a typo?  You can register custom marks to avoid this warning - for details, see https://docs.pytest.org/en/latest/mark.html PytestUnknownMarkWarning,

pytest.mark.allure_label.feature - is this a typo?  You can register custom marks to avoid this warning - for details, see https://docs.pytest.org/en/latest/mark.html PytestUnknownMarkWarning,

pytest.mark.allure_label.story - is this a typo?  You can register custom marks to avoid this warning - for details, see https://docs.pytest.org/en/latest/mark.htmlPytestUnknownMarkWarning,
```

#5023: New flag --strict-markers that triggers an error when unknown markers (e.g. those not registered using the markers option in the configuration file) are used in the test suite.

The existing --strict option has the same behavior currently, but can be augmented in the future for additional checks.

https://docs.pytest.org/en/latest/changelog.html

items.title: AllureFormatter not erroring when trying to write *-result.json to -o {file_path}
items.body:
**Describe the bug**
This took far longer to debug than it should have. 

`$ behave -f allure_behave.formatter:AllureFormatter -o %allure_result_folder% ./features`

If not in the correct directory when tests begin to run, with access`%allure_result_folder%` above, Behave does not error out. The `*-result.json` files were expecting to be in the allure_result_folder to generate the report with, simply don't appear.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1) Run behave tests from `/features` directory but specify flags to `-f allure_behave.formatter:AllureFormatter -o %allure_result_folder%` where `%allure_result_folder%` isn't a sub directory of `/features` but a directory of it's parent. 
2) `json` files won't be written to the expected directory. No errors.

**Expected behavior**
json results from each Behave step to be kicked out **OR ERROR**
Ex:  0392d7c9-bdee-4c55-8ba1-05a5e02cc54b-result.json

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

**Environment (please complete the following information):**

allure-behave==2.5.4
allure-python-commons==2.5.4
behave==1.2.6

Generating report using custom allure docker container **- issue is not happening here.**

**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.

items.title: allure plugin doesn't have human name
items.body:
I have to dynamically change description of the test. At this moment I find only such solution: ``` def pytest_runtest_makereport(item, call): for plugin in item.config.pluginmanager.list_name_plugin(): p = plugin[1] if isinstance(p, AllureListener): uuid = p._cache.get(item.nodeid) test_result = p.allure_logger.get_test(uuid) if test_result.descriptionHtml is None: test_result.descriptionHtml = '' else: test_result.descriptionHtml = '

' test_result.descriptionHtml += 'ya.ry ``` I would prefer code: ``` def pytest_runtest_makereport(item, call): p = item.config.pluginmanager.get_plugin('allure_report'): uuid = p._cache.get(item.nodeid) ... ``` but your plugin doesn't have name because of code in module allure_pytest.plugin.py:121 is `config.pluginmanager.register(test_listener)` but should be `config.pluginmanager.register(test_listener, 'allure_report')` if you do not point name, than name is generated as random numeric PS: maybe you suggest less complicated approach to dynamically set description of the test?

items.title: Behave on parallel mode failed with msg: behave: error: unrecognized arguments: --processes --parallel-element feature
items.body:
#### I'm submitting a ... 
  - [* ] bug report
  - [ ] feature request
  - [ ] support request => Please do not submit support request here, see note at the top of this template.

#### What is the current behavior?
When I'm try run tests on paralel mod with installed `allure-behave` and  `allure-python-commons`, all test failed with error:
`behave: error: unrecognized arguments: --processes --parallel-element feature`. 
Without paralel mode all tests working.

#### If the current behavior is a bug, please provide the steps to reproduce and if possible a minimal demo of the problem
I used thiss command:
`behave-parallel --no-capture --no-color --junit -f allure_behave.formatter:AllureFormatter -o allure-results --processes 1 --parallel-element feature  features/*`

#### What is the expected behavior?
Run all tests on paralell/single mode and generate report.

#### What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior?
Will be very helpful use allure on parallel mode 

#### Please tell us about your environment:

- Allure version:        2.9.0
- Test framework:        behave@1.2.6
                                    behave-parallel@1.2.4a1
- Allure adaptor:         allure-behave@2.5.5
                                   allure-python-commons@2.5.5
- python:                    2.7.15

items.title: backward compatibility for using pytest.allure.step  instead of allure.step decorator
items.body:
We are developing a test framework using pytest and allure as reporting tool. We have been using allure for long and allure1 is in production. We have close to several hundred of scripts that are using "@pytest.allure.step" as decorator to create a step which was supported by allure1 . However this  "@pytest.allure.step" is not supported by allure2 pytest. 

Is there any backward compatibility that i can use without changing all my scripts?

items.title: Support for behave which is running on parallel mode - now allure-results directory is creating empty.
items.body:
#### I'm submitting a ... 
  - [x] bug report
  - [] feature request
  - [ ] support request => Please do not submit support request here, see note at the top of this template.

#### What is the current behavior?
When I'm using behave from this branch https://github.com/behave/behave/issues/710 (where is possible to use behave in the parallel mode) directory allure-results is creating empty.

#### If the current behavior is a bug, please provide the steps to reproduce and if possible a minimal demo of the problem

I used this command 
`behave --processes 3 --parallel-element feature  -f allure_behave.formatter:AllureFormatter -o allure_test_results ./features`

and after run this folder is creating but empty when I'm using behave without `--processes 3 --parallel-element feature` that allure-results directory is creating correctly.

#### What is the expected behavior?
That Allure works  in other forks when there is parallel support so it will be very helpful to have this possibility also for behave.

#### What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior?
Parallel run of tests is one of the most important thing in my opinion because always we want to decrease execution time.

#### Please tell us about your environment:

- Allure version:         2.8.0
- Test framework:      behave 1.2.7.dev0
- Allure adaptor:        allure-behave@2.5.4

items.title: [Feature Request]Need Allure Support for Pytest-Tavern YAML based API testing framework
items.body:
Need feature support for PyTest Tavern plugin test reporting support.This python package makes use of YAML for validating REST API behaviours and responses.Tavern API tests are triggered using pytest and pytest have the capability to identify yaml test scenarios and will validate against the requirements.Tavern plugin mostly widely used plugin for validating REST API tests because of simplicity. Right now we don't have any sophisticated reporting framework like Allure.I saw good reporting features through various blogs hence asking support for this.

For more information about Tavern Pytest plugin please refer this link 
https://taverntesting.github.io

items.title: pytest v4.0.0 introduces breaking changes to allure-pytest
items.body:
[//]: # (
. Note: for support questions, please use Stackoverflow or Gitter**. 
. This repository's issues are reserved for feature requests and bug reports.
.
. In case of any problems with Allure Jenkins plugin** please use the following repository 
. to create an issue: https://github.com/jenkinsci/allure-plugin/issues
.
. Make sure you have a clear name for your issue. The name should start with a capital 
. letter and no dot is required in the end of the sentence. An example of good issue names:
.
. - The report is broken in IE11
. - Add an ability to disable default plugins
. - Support emoji in test descriptions
)

#### I'm submitting a ... 
  - [x] bug report
  - [ ] feature request
  - [ ] support request => Please do not submit support request here, see note at the top of this template.

#### What is the current behavior?
allure-pytest now raises errors where there were previously warnings (see existing issue https://github.com/allure-framework/allure-pytest/issues/146).  This occurs due to an upgrade in the severity from warning to error introduced in pytest [v4.0.0](https://docs.pytest.org/en/latest/changelog.html#pytest-4-0-0-2018-11-13)

#### If the current behavior is a bug, please provide the steps to reproduce and if possible a minimal demo of the problem
See two files in [this gist](https://gist.github.com/matt-l-w/75e53b7c9fdb60706f95d76a35d3f977)
The test has been pinched from [an existing issue](https://github.com/allure-framework/allure-python/issues/307).


#### What is the expected behavior?
No errors.

#### What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior?
The library will not work without this fix.

#### Please tell us about your environment:

- Allure version:        2.1.0
- Test framework:        pytest@4.0.0
- Allure adaptor:        allure-pytest@2.5.3

#### What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior?

##### https://docs.pytest.org/en/latest/mark.html#updating-code

> using function of pytest `get_closet_marker' to replace the `get_marker'

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15834891/48390462-1ff56f80-e73d-11e8-9a5e-e7f34a710c92.png)

##### in utils.py,
> in function `allure_labels` and `allure_links`, using `get_closet_marker' to replace the `get_marker'
> in function `get_marker_value` , using `get_closest_marker` to replace `keywords.get`

```python
# in utils.py
def get_marker_value(item, keyword):
    #marker = item.keywords.get(keyword)
    marker = item.get_closest_marker(keyword)
    return marker.args[0] if marker and marker.args else None


def allure_labels(item):
    for keyword in item.keywords.keys():
        if keyword.startswith(ALLURE_LABEL_PREFIX):
            #marker = item.get_marker(keyword)
            marker = item.get_closest_marker(keyword)
            label_type = marker.kwargs['label_type']
            if label_type in ALLURE_UNIQUE_LABELS:
                yield (label_type, marker.args[0])
            else:
                for value in marker.args:
                    yield (label_type, value)


def allure_links(item):
    for keyword in item.keywords.keys():
        if keyword.startswith(ALLURE_LINK_PREFIX):
            #marker = item.get_marker(keyword)
            marker = item.get_closest_marker(keyword)
            link_type = marker.kwargs['link_type']
            url = marker.args[0]
            name = marker.kwargs['name']
            yield (link_type, url, name)

```

#### Please tell us about your environment:

#### What is the current behavior?

Pytest command line parameters are not recognized by @allure.feature/@allure.story decorators. 

##############################################

# content of conftest.py

def pytest_addoption(parser):
    parser.addoption("--stringinputs", action="append", default=[],
        help="list of stringinputs to pass to test functions")

def pytest_generate_tests(metafunc):
    if 'inst' in metafunc.fixturenames:
        metafunc.parametrize("stringinputs",
                             metafunc.config.getoption('stringinputs'))

###############################################

# content of a test module run with pytest --stringinputs 'test123' --alluredir . 

import allure
import pytest

@allure.feature('Acceptance tests for new builds.')
@allure.story(stringinputs)
@allure.title('Scenario: Board new data')
def test_boarding(stringinputs):
    assert True

The above will abort as Allure does not recognize the stringinputs variable. The Pytest test case will recognize stringinputs. 

#### If the current behavior is a bug, please provide the steps to reproduce and if possible a minimal demo of the problem


#### What is the expected behavior?

the @allure.story decorator should replace the variable stringinputs with the command line supplied value which is passed into the test case via metafunc.parametrize 

#### What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior?

Tests must be organized under a single story if command line parameters are used. We would like to organize tests under a feature and story based upon the command line parameters, similar to Cucumber outline scenarios. 


#### Please tell us about your environment:

- Allure version:        2.6.0
- Test framework:        pytest@3.7.1

items.title: Tests with exceptions marks as broken
items.body:
[//]: # (
. Note: for support questions, please use Stackoverflow or Gitter**. 
. This repository's issues are reserved for feature requests and bug reports.
.
. In case of any problems with Allure Jenkins plugin** please use the following repository 
. to create an issue: https://github.com/jenkinsci/allure-plugin/issues
.
. Make sure you have a clear name for your issue. The name should start with a capital 
. letter and no dot is required in the end of the sentence. An example of good issue names:
.
. - The report is broken in IE11
. - Add an ability to disable default plugins
. - Support emoji in test descriptions
)

#### I'm submitting a ... 
  - [x] bug report
  - [ ] feature request
  - [ ] support request => Please do not submit support request here, see note at the top of this template.

#### What is the current behavior?
If test encountered any kind of exception, allure plugin marks him as broken.

#### If the current behavior is a bug, please provide the steps to reproduce and if possible a minimal demo of the problem
Test example:
```python
def test_stuff():
    raise Exception('whoa!')
```
JSON:
```json
{"name": "test_stuff", "status": "broken", "statusDetails": {"message": "Exception: whoa!", "trace": "test_4_stuff.py:14: in test_stuff\n    raise Exception('whoa!')\nE   Exception: whoa!"}}
```

#### What is the expected behavior?
If there is some exception in test, In `<...>-result.json` this test will have `"status": "failed"`.  
But if this exception was in, for example, fixture, there's definitely some weird things that needs to be marked as **broken**. 

#### What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior?
I think having exceptions is _normal_ for Python. If in my test goes something wrong, it'll rather raise exception instead of returning None...

#### Please tell us about your environment:

- Test framework:        pytest@3.6.0
- Allure adaptor:        allure-pytest@2.3.3b1
- Python: 3.6.5

#### Other information 

[//]: # (
. e.g. detailed explanation, stacktraces, related issues, suggestions 
. how to fix, links for us to have more context, eg. Stackoverflow, Gitter etc
)
...but I'm not sure is it necessary to mark _all_ tests that have exceptions as _failed_.  
For example, if my test encountered some `MyApiException`, it's safe to assume that test is not broken, he's just failed. But if there is some serious stuff like `requests.exceptions.ConnectionError`, there's something wrong, because my test assumed that connection will be established and I could make request at least. 
IMHO, there could be some argument parameter like `--allure-exception=BaseException`, and if test was failed because of exception inherited of BaseException, test will be marked as failed. Otherwise test is **really** broken.

items.body: [//]: # ( . Note: for support questions, please use Stackoverflow or Gitter**. . This repository's issues are reserved for feature requests and bug reports. . . In case of any problems with Allure Jenkins plugin** please use the following repository . to create an issue: https://github.com/jenkinsci/allure-plugin/issues . . Make sure you have a clear name for your issue. The name should start with a capital . letter and no dot is required in the end of the sentence. An example of good issue names: . . - The report is broken in IE11 . - Add an ability to disable default plugins . - Support emoji in test descriptions ) #### I'm submitting a ... - [x ] bug report - [ ] feature request - [ ] support request => Please do not submit support request here, see note at the top of this template. #### What is the current behavior? Scenarios in Behave that have failing steps, gets reported under Suits with a "Passed" status and is "Green" instead of "Red" In the demo below "Bug_demo_2" Suite should be "failed" with "red" colouring #### If the current behavior is a bug, please provide the steps to reproduce and if possible a minimal demo of the problem In steps.py: ``` def str_to_bool(string): if string == 'True': return True elif string == 'False': return False @Given('Value is "{value}"') def step_impl(context, value): context.test_val = str_to_bool(value) @When('comared to "{value}"') def step_impl(context, value): context.result = value is str_to_bool(context.test_val) @Then('Result should be "{value}"') def step_impl(context, value): assert context.result is str_to_bool(value) ``` In bug.feature: ``` Feature: Bug report Scenario: Bug_demo_1 Given Value is "True" When comared to "False" Then Result should be "False" Scenario: Bug_demo_2 Given Value is "True" When comared to "False" Then Result should be "True" ``` Run with: `behave -f allure_behave.formatter:AllureFormatter -o allure-results tests/bdd/features/ allure serve` #### What is the expected behavior? #### What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior? I am thinking/convinced this an bug #### Please tell us about your environment: - Allure version: 2.3.5 - Test framework: behave 1.2.6 - Allure adaptor: allure-behave 2.3.2b1 #### Other information [//]: # ( . e.g. detailed explanation, stacktraces, related issues, suggestions . how to fix, links for us to have more context, eg. Stackoverflow, Gitter etc ) [https://stackoverflow.com/questions/50246929/allure-behave-not-reporting-failed-suits-as-failed](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/50246929/allure-behave-not-reporting-failed-suits-as-failed) UPDATE: I created a script to fix the misreporting after the results files were generated. This gived me the results I need: ```` import os import fileinput import re import sys rootdir = 'allure-results' for subdir, dirs, files in os.walk(rootdir): for result_file in files: print result_file with open(rootdir + '/' + result_file, "r+") as f: for line in f: if '"status": "failed"' in line: line = line.replace('"status": "passed"','"status": "failed"', 1) print result_file sys.stdout.write(line) f.seek(0) f.truncate() f.write(line) ````

items.title: Hide self from step parameters by default
items.body:
#### I'm submitting a ... 
  - [ ] bug report
  - [x] feature request
  - [ ] support request => Please do not submit support request here, see note at the top of this template.

#### What is the current behavior?

```python
class SomeClass:
    @allure.step("Title")
    def some_method(self):
        pass
SomeClass().some_method()
```

Now allure report for this code will contain a step with name "Title" and with 1 parameter `self`.

#### What is the expected behavior?

I believe that report must contain the step without parameter `self` by default.
I offer to implement optional parameter if you like to see `self` in parameters list.

```python
@allure.step("Title", show_self=True)
```

#### What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior?

In most cases there is no need to see `self` in parameters list.

#### Please tell us about your environment:

- Test framework:        pytest@3.5.1
- Allure adaptor:        allure-pytest@2.3.2b1

items.title: attach - self.stack[-1] will raise IndexError if stack is empty
items.body:
```
    def attach(self, title, contents, attach_type):
        """
        Attaches ``contents`` with ``title`` and ``attach_type`` to the current active thing
        """
        attach = Attach(
            source=self._save_attach(contents, attach_type=attach_type),
            title=title,
            type=attach_type.mime_type)
        self.stack[-1].attachments.append(attach)
```
this self.stack[-1] will raise IndexError if stack is empty (stack=[]).
This can happen if for example suite fails on class setup.

items.title: Example Variables in Scenario Outlines description not showing up in Allure Report
items.body:
#### I'm submitting a ... 
  - [ x] bug report
  - [ ] feature request

#### What is the current behavior?
If you include a [Variable in the Scenario outline](http://behave.readthedocs.io/en/latest/new_and_noteworthy_v1.2.5.html#name-may-contain-placeholders) it doesn't fill that variable in for the name of the test.

#### Steps:
A feature file that includes a Scenario Outline and examples. And uses the examples in the Scenario Outline name.
```
Feature: Not supported yet

  Scenario Outline: Wow <name>-<birthyear>
    Given ...
    Then ... 
    Examples:
    | name  | birthyear |
    | Alice |  1985     |
    | Bob   |  1975     |
```
Under the feature "Not supported yet" two test will appear named "`Wow <name>-<birthyear>`".

#### What is the expected behavior?
Two test would appear named: "`Wow Alice-1985`" & "`Wow Bob-1975`"

#### What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior?
It does a better job of describing tests than example tags appearing to the right of the title.

#### Please tell us about your environment:
- Allure version:        2.6.0
- Test framework:     behave@1.2.6
- Allure adaptor:      allure-behave@2.3.2b1

items.title: Behave Allure reports include Skipped tests when using --no-skipped or show_skipped = false
items.body:
#### I'm submitting a ... 
  - [ x] bug report
  - [ ] feature request

#### What is the current behavior?
Skipped issues appear in Allure Results even if Skipped `--no-skipped` flag is set or behave.ini is set to `show_skipped = false`.

#### Steps:
1. Create two senarios with different tags (for example 1 test tagged @chrome and another tagged @firefox). 
2. Run the tests with a feature --tag that will skip a test (`behave features/ --tags chrome --no-skipped`)

#### What is the expected behavior?
Skipped tests won't be included in allure results.

#### What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior?
In my case I'm trying to run chrome tests in CI against a selenium/standalone-chrome and Firefox against selenium/standalone-firefox docker images because my companies CI tool doesn't work with the Hub and Node configuration. And whichever runs last shows up as the most recent version of test for both browsers. But really it just seems like if ignore skipped is turned on it should not be included in the result. 

#### Please tell us about your environment:

- Allure version:        2.6.0
- Test framework:     behave@1.2.6
- Allure adaptor:      allure-behave@2.3.2b1

items.title: Report shows wrong attachments for parameterized fixtures
items.body:
#### I'm submitting a ... 
  - [x] bug report

#### What is the current behavior?
Report shows wrong attachments for parameterized fixtures

#### If the current behavior is a bug, please provide the steps to reproduce and if possible a minimal demo of the problem
Simple test to run as an example of the bug:
```
import allure
import pytest
import time

@pytest.fixture(scope="module", params=["a","b","c","d","e","f"])
def letter(request):
    timestamp = time.ctime()
    allure.attach(str(timestamp), "Log", attachment_type=allure.attachment_type.TEXT)
    print(timestamp)
    return request.param

def test_letter(letter):
    time.sleep(1)
    assert True
```

On pytest output you can see three different timestamps with one sec difference from each other, like:
```
'a': Mon Feb 12 17:40:07 2018
'b' :Mon Feb 12 17:40:08 2018
'c': Mon Feb 12 17:40:09 2018
'd': Mon Feb 12 17:40:10 2018
'e': Mon Feb 12 17:40:11 2018
'f': Mon Feb 12 17:40:12 2018
```
But on the Logs, you can see it prints on set up, for each of the tests:
```
'a': Mon Feb 12 17:40:07 2018
'b' :Mon Feb 12 17:40:07 2018
'c': Mon Feb 12 17:40:08 2018
'd': Mon Feb 12 17:40:09 2018
'e': Mon Feb 12 17:40:10 2018
'f': Mon Feb 12 17:40:11 2018
```
So it repeats the setup attachment for letter 'b' and then keep with the sequence (therefore of course attachments are wrong on all tests).

#### What is the expected behavior?

Attachments should belong to the fixture instance it belongs to.

#### Please tell us about your environment:

- Allure version:        2.5.0
- Test framework:        pytest@3.4.0
- Allure adaptor:        allure-pytest@2.3.2b1

#### Other information

. e.g. detailed explanation, stacktraces, related issues, suggestions

#### I'm submitting a ... 
  - [ ] feature request

#### What is the expected behavior?

It is required to display the test-method parameter in the @allure.title()

```

items.title: allure screenshot attachment not present in report
items.body:
I have a BDD framework and in an 'after_step' block I want to attach a .png screenshot to a failed test. I am running a test from the PyCharm IDE with `behave\__main__.py `as my script and with the following commands:` -t run --junit --junit-directory path\to\my\junit-xml `

In a failed test scenario, the code will be sent to an "after_step" block in the `environment.py` file of the Behave framework. The following code is used to (try to) attach a screenshot (with allure imported): 

`allure.attach(context.browser.driver.get_screenshot_as_png(), name="screenshot", attachment_type=AttachmentType.PNG) `

After the test fails i am opening a command line and passing the following: 

`allure serve path\to\my\junit-xml `
^ the same path my command line argument i passed to behave. 

I am opening the report and seeing the singular failed test but there is no screenshot attached. 

I've also tried many other alternatives in the after_step block, one of which was just to make sure that I was actually creating the screenshot in the first place: 

```
screen_path = 'path\to\new\screen.png'
failure_screen = context.browser.driver.save_screenshot(screen_path)
allure.attach(failure_screen, name="screenshot", attachment_type=AttachmentType.PNG)
```

None of which will produce a screenshot in the generated report.

items.title: Problems with reporting errors
items.body:
[//]: # (
. Note: for support questions, please use Stackoverflow or Gitter**. 
. This repository's issues are reserved for feature requests and bug reports.
.
. In case of any problems with Allure Jenkins plugin** please use the following repository 
. to create an issue: https://github.com/jenkinsci/allure-plugin/issues
.
. Make sure you have a clear name for your issue. The name should start with a capital 
. letter and no dot is required in the end of the sentence. An example of good issue names:
.
. - The report is broken in IE11
. - Add an ability to disable default plugins
. - Support emoji in test descriptions
)

#### I'm submitting a ... 
  - [x] bug report
  - [ ] feature request
  - [ ] support request => Please do not submit support request here, see note at the top of this template.

#### What is the current behavior?
If test was not xfailed and Exception had no message specified - there will be no information about error in report. That is because message presense is checked by presense of attribute in object, which is allways present, but equal to None without message.
https://github.com/allure-framework/allure-python/blob/master/allure-pytest/src/listener.py#L146

#### If the current behavior is a bug, please provide the steps to reproduce and if possible a minimal demo of the problem
```python
def test_broken_test():
    raise IndentationError()
```
